resources.string: The Grand Mosque Security Operations Center uses the latest AI technologies

The Grand Mosque Security Operations Center is a key component of the security system for pilgrims, worshippers, and visitors. 

It relies on the latest smart technologies and AI-based predictive capabilities, enhancing the safety of pilgrims, facilitating their movement, and providing them with the best services during the rituals. 

The center utilizes high-resolution digital surveillance cameras and AI technologies capable of analyzing big data and predicting congestion. 

This enables proactive decisions to reduce congestion and ensure smooth flow within the Grand Mosque, while also accurately relaying traffic reports. 

The center's responsibilities include monitoring pilgrims from their arrival at the Grand Mosque until their departure, ensuring a safe and comfortable experience. 

It offers a variety of services, including monitoring security, providing humanitarian and awareness support, and monitoring the overall situation around the clock.
Saudi Arabia celebrates \"Flag Day\" tomorrow, in pride of its national values

Tomorrow, Tuesday, Ramadan 11, 1446 AH, corresponding to March 11, 2025 AD, the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia will celebrate "Flag Day" the day on which King Abdulaziz bin Abdulrahman Al Saud - may God have mercy on him - recognized the flag with its great connotations that point to monotheism, justice, strength, growth, and prosperity. 

This date was on Dhu al-Hijjah 27, 1355 AH, corresponding to March 11, 1937 AD.
Implanting an artificial heart pump without a chest incision using a robot

King Faisal Specialist Hospital and Research Centre in Riyadh has achieved a new global medical milestone by performing the world's first fully robotic implantation of a HeartMate 3 artificial heart pump. The operation was performed on a 35-year-old patient. 

The procedure, performed by a specialized robotic surgery team led by Dr. Firas Khalil, Head of the Cardiac Surgery Department at the hospital, significantly reduced the typical side effects of thoracotomy, such as scarring and pain, as well as the rate of complications and stress for the patient. 

This resulted in a reduction in the patient's stay in intensive care to only four days, compared to an average of 26 days for similar traditional surgeries, which require a large chest incision and a longer recovery period of up to 63 days. 

Doctors expect the patient to be discharged from the hospital within ten days. 

This achievement is part of a series of successes for King Faisal Specialist Hospital and Research Centre, having previously performed the world's first robotic heart transplant and the world's first robotic liver transplant. 

These achievements reflect the hospital's commitment to providing innovative medical solutions that keep pace with the latest technological developments and consolidate its global leadership. 

It is worth noting that King Faisal Specialist Hospital and Research Centre has been ranked first in the Middle East and Africa and 20th globally for the second consecutive year, among the top 250 academic healthcare institutions worldwide. 

It was also named the most valuable healthcare brand in the Kingdom and the Middle East, according to the Brand Finance 2024 report, and was included in the list of the world's best smart hospitals for 2025, according to Newsweek magazine.
Cat owner leaves hilarious sign warning people about her \'actress\' pet

The note, left by a cat owner outside an Iceland store in Liverpool, warns people not to feed the cat as she has a home and is an 'actress' who loves attention. 

An hilarious note penned by the owner of a fame-hungry cat has tickled social media users after it was shared online. 

Perched outside the Iceland supermarket on Liverpool's Penny Lane, the heartwarming message stated: "Please do not feed the black and white cat. 

My name is Lili and I have a home on Kenyon Rd. 

I am an actress\! I like attention\! I like food\! It is very kind of you, but please stop feeding me because I will spend less time at home. 

Thank you\!" Alongside the message in the shared image sat the cat in question, Lili, a gorgeous black and white feline who seemingly had no plans to abandon her profitable perch near the store. 

The picture and tale went viral on Reddit, amassing over 4,000 upvotes and numerous comments from individuals who'd encountered the notable kitty
